::: contentWrapper
# Photos taken by Vector {#photos-taken-by-vector .title}

[](javascript:window.print() "Print this article"){.printArticle
aria-label="Print this Article"}

[Learn in this FAQ how to ask Vector to take photos, how to export them,
where the photos are stored and more.]{style="font-weight: 400;"}

[**[How to take a photo](#h_107409751538839253375) \|\| [View and export
pictures taken by Vector](#h_107409751538839253375) \|\|  [The world
through Vector\'s eyes](#h_107409751538839253375) \|\|  [Where are the
photos stored?](#h_107409751538839253375)**]{.wysiwyg-color-black}

::: sections
## How to take a photo

-   [Ask Vector to take a picture by giving him a command by voice: "Hey
    Vector, take a photo" and you'll hear a simulated shutter
    sound.]{.wysiwyg-color-black}
-   [Vector does not take videos.]{.wysiwyg-color-black}
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
## View and export pictures taken by Vector

-   [You can view the picture from the Vector App, and from there,
    delete, share, or save it to your phone or
    tablet.]{.wysiwyg-color-black style="font-weight: 400;"}
-   [Select \"Utilities\" \> tap \"VECTOR\'S PHOTOS\" \> Select a photo
    \> tap \"export photo\".]{.wysiwyg-color-black
    style="font-weight: 400;"}
-   [[Note that on Android devices, there will be a \"photo exported\"
    confirmation. ]{style="font-weight: 400;"}[On iOS, there will not be
    any confirmation.]{style="font-weight: 400;"} This is by
    design.]{.wysiwyg-color-black}
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
## The world through Vector\'s eyes

-   [Vector uses a HD Camera with a 120-degree, ultra wide field of
    vision. ]{.wysiwyg-color-black style="font-weight: 400;"}
-   [If you are wondering why the resolution and quality of pictures
    Vector takes may not be in line with what  you would expect,
    remember:]{.wysiwyg-color-black style="font-weight: 400;"}
-   [**You are seeing the world through Vector's eyes.**[ He does not
    see the world in the same way we
    do.]{style="font-weight: 400;"}]{.wysiwyg-color-black}

[ ]{.wysiwyg-color-black}

[                   
 ![vision.png](//d33v4339jhl8k0.cloudfront.net/docs/assets/5e3f0b1e2c7d3a7e9ae777f5/images/5e7d76f22c7d3a7e9ae9e349/img-25345-1585280584-1470193932.png)  ]{.wysiwyg-color-black
style="font-weight: 400;"}
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

::: sections
## Where are the photos stored?

-   [Any pictures are saved to Vector's onboard
    memory]{.wysiwyg-color-black}
-   Your photos are not sent to or stored in the cloud
-   You can delete pictures saved to Vector anytime through the Vector
    app
-   When Vector is on, his camera is always on so he can see and react
    to the world around him
-   To turn it off and stop data streaming, you need to turn off Vector
    by pressing and holding his Back Button for 5 seconds
-   For further information on Vector and privacy, please refer
    to **[this
    FAQ](//support.digitaldreamlabs.com/article/105-vector-security-privacy-faqs)**
:::
